intro: Hieracium manadenium, commonly known as the Alpine hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its leaves are basal, rosette-like, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Hieracium manadenium is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in harsh, high-altitude environments.
